name: 陳雅玫
objective: This course aims to introduce the "globalization turn" and "technological turn" in translation studies after the 1990s. An exploration will be made into their possible implications for translation practice and the translator's qualifications. Translation issues to be addressed may include the following: globalization/localization and translation, technology and translation, transcreation (creative translation), advertisement/marketing and translation, video game translation, website translation, tourism translation, quality control, community/crowdsourcing translation and fansubbing. Through concrete examples of authentic translations, this course will enable students to better understand how the new trends in translation studies can guide translation practice, and lead students to rethink the translators professional qualifications. Also included in the course are practical English'/Chinese translation exercises and translation commentaries, which can assist students in keeping abreast with the new trends and formulating appropriate translation strategies.
